homeExemptions.postDeathTreatment: subject to recovery only if part of probate estate and no protected heirs survive

recoveryTimeframes.statuteLimit: within 90 days of death or probate notice

criteria: heir would face eviction or homelessness
loss of sole income or essential property

spousalProtections.jointPropertyTreatment: not subject to recovery while spouse is alive
additionalProtections: no recovery from estate of surviving spouse

administrative.agency: Mississippi Division of Medicaid, Estate Recovery Unit

programEffectiveness.estatesPursued: probate estates with real property or substantial liquid assets

effectiveStrategies: use revocable trusts, joint tenancy, and TOD deeds to avoid probate
establish QIT if income exceeds Medicaid cap
apply for hardship waiver for dependent or low-income heirs
coordinate titles and beneficiary designations to keep assets out of probate
